title: Island Style / ‘Oiwi E
lyrics:
[intro] (C)  (G7)  (C)
 
[chorus, slow strum]
On the (F)island, we do it island (C)style
From the (C)mountain to the ocean
From the (G7)windward to the leeward (C)side (C7)
On the (F)island, we do it island (C)style
From the (C)mountain to the ocean
From the (G7)windward to the leeward (C)side
 
(C)Mama's in the kitchen cooking (F)dinner real (C)nice
Beef (C)stew on the stove, lomi (G7)salmon with the (C)ice
(C) We eat and drink, and we (F)sing all (C)day
(C) Kani ka pila in the (G7)old Hawaiian (C)way
 
[chorus]
On the (F)island, we do it island (C)style
From the (C)mountain to the ocean
From the (G7)windward to the leeward (C)side (C7)
On the (F)island, we do it island (C)style
From the (C)mountain to the ocean
From the (G7)windward to the leeward (C)side
 
We (C)go grandma’s house on the (F)weekend clean (C)yard
’Cause (C) if we no go, grandma (G7)gotta work (C)hard
(C) You know my grandma she like the (F)poi real (C)sour
(C) I love my grandma every (G7)minute every (C)hour
 
[chorus]
On the (F)island, we do it island (C)style
From the (C)mountain to the ocean
From the (G7)windward to the leeward (C)side (C7)
On the (F)island, we do it island (C)style
From the (C)mountain to the ocean
From the (G7)windward to the leeward (C)side
 
[interlude]
(C) (F-C) (C) (G7-C)
(C) (F-C) (C) (G7-C)
 
[chorus]
On the (F)island, we do it island (C)style
From the (C)mountain to the ocean
From the (G7)windward to the leeward (C)side (C7)
On the (F)island, we do it island (C)style
From the (C)mountain to the ocean
From the (G7)windward to the leeward (C)side (kupa’a ke kanaka) [straight in]
From the (C)mountain to the ocean
From the (G7)windward to the leeward (C)side (kupa’a ke kanaka) [straight in]
From the (C)mountain to the ocean
From the (G7)windward to the leeward (C)side (kupa’a ke kanaka) (C↓) (E7↓)
 
[faster strum]
(A)‘Oiwi e (A)(‘oiwi e)
(D) Kahea e na ‘iwi (A)e
(A)Ua ‘ike mai nei (A)(ua ‘ike mai nei)
(E7)Ku’u one hanau (A)e
(A)Eia mai la (A)(eia mai la)
Na(D)kupa’aina o Hawai’i (A)nei
(A)Kako’o mai nei (A)(kako’o mai nei)
(E7)Kupa’a lokahi (A)e
 
(E (A7)kikilo e na iwi)
(D)Kikilo e na iwi, (A)e na mamo e
(A) Na kini makamaka (E7)e
(e (E7)kupa’a ke kanaka) (A)Kupa’a ke kanaka
(D)Hanohano ha’aheo (A)e
((A)Ku ke kanaka), (A)kupa’a ke kanaka, (E7)hanohano ha’aheo (A)e
 
(A)‘Oiwi e (A)(‘oiwi e)
(D) Kahea e na ‘iwi (A)e
(A)Ua ‘ike mai nei (A)(ua ‘ike mai nei)
(E7)Ku’u one hanau (A)e
(A)Eia mai la (A)(eia mai la)
Na(D)kupa’aina o Hawai’i (A)nei
(A)Kako’o mai nei (A)(kako’o mai nei)
(E7)Kupa’a lokahi (A)e
 
(E (A7)kikilo e na iwi)
(D)Kikilo e na iwi, (A)e na mamo e
(A) Na kini makamaka (E7)e
(e (E7)kupa’a ke kanaka) (A)Kupa’a ke kanaka
(D)Hanohano ha’aheo (A)e
((A)Ku ke kanaka), (A)kupa’a ke kanaka, (E7)hanohano ha’aheo (A)e
((A)Ku ke kanaka), (A)kupa’a ke kanaka, (E7)hanohano ha’aheo (A)e
(Kahi lua kolu ha, (A-stop) kia ora hi!) [end]
